metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31747 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers Andrew McCreight, Nicolas B. Pierron, and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 100 and Firefox ESR 91.9. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.10, Firefox < 101, and Firefox ESR < 91.10.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31747` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

thunderbird - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
